title: Hannah's Prayer and Eli's Sons
shortSummary: 1 Samuel 2 presents Hannah's heartfelt prayer of praise to God following the birth of Samuel, highlighting God's sovereignty and justice. The chapter contrasts Hannah's faithful devotion with the corrupt behavior of Eli's sons, setting the stage for God's judgment and the rise of a faithful priest.
timeline: c. 1100 BC - Period of the Judges, early monarchy formation in Israel

keyCharacters.name: Hannah
keyCharacters.description: The mother of Samuel who prays a profound prayer of thanksgiving and praise to God after God answers her prayer for a child.

keyCharacters.name: Samuel
keyCharacters.description: The young boy dedicated to the Lord by Hannah, who ministers before Eli and grows in favor with God and man.

keyCharacters.name: Eli
keyCharacters.description: The high priest and judge of Israel, who rebukes his sons for their wickedness but fails to restrain them effectively.

keyCharacters.name: Hophni and Phinehas
keyCharacters.description: Sons of Eli, described as corrupt priests who abuse their priestly office and provoke God's judgment.

definitions.definition: A biblical symbol of strength and power, often representing honor and victory.
A priestly garment worn by Israelite priests, symbolizing their office and service before God.
A term meaning worthless or wicked, used here to describe the corrupt character of Eli’s sons.
An offering made to God, often involving animals, symbolizing atonement, worship, and dedication.

outline.heading: Hannah's Prayer of Praise
outline.description: Hannah offers a powerful prayer exalting God's holiness, justice, and sovereignty, celebrating His ability to humble the proud and exalt the humble.

outline.heading: Samuel's Service and Eli's Sons' Wickedness
outline.description: Samuel ministers faithfully before the Lord, while Eli’s sons corrupt the priesthood by exploiting the sacrificial system and showing disrespect to God.

outline.heading: Samuel's Growth and Eli's Rebuke
outline.description: Samuel grows in favor with God and people; Eli confronts his sons about their sinful behavior but they refuse to listen, demonstrating the consequences of disobedience.

outline.heading: Prophecy of Judgment Against Eli's House
outline.description: A man of God delivers a divine judgment against Eli’s family, declaring the end of their priestly line and promising the rise of a faithful priest who will serve God’s purposes.

application: Trust in God's sovereignty and justice, knowing He exalts the humble and humbles the proud in His perfect timing.
Commit to faithful service before the Lord like Samuel, growing in favor with God and others through obedience and humility.
Guard against corruption and disrespect in spiritual leadership, understanding the serious consequences of sin in the house of God.
Respond to godly rebuke with repentance and humility, rather than stubbornness, to avoid God's discipline.

keyVerses.text: There is none holy as the LORD: for there is none beside thee: neither is there any rock like our God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes God's unparalleled holiness and strength, foundational for understanding His character.

keyVerses.text: The adversaries of the LORD shall be broken to pieces; out of heaven shall he thunder upon them: the LORD shall judge the ends of the earth; and he shall give strength unto his king, and exalt the horn of his anointed.
keyVerses.significance: It foretells God's judgment on His enemies and His empowerment of His chosen king, pointing forward to the Messiah.

keyVerses.text: And the child Samuel grew on, and was in favour both with the LORD, and also with men.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the importance of spiritual growth and favor in both divine and human eyes.

keyVerses.text: And I will raise me up a faithful priest, that shall do according to that which is in mine heart and in my mind: and I will build him a sure house; and he shall walk before mine anointed for ever.
keyVerses.significance: A prophetic promise of a faithful priestly figure, ultimately fulfilled in Christ, who perfectly serves God's purposes.
